snippet: Even as Israeli forces moved to demolish militants’ tunnels into Israel, several Hamas fighters slipped through passages on Saturday and fought gun battles with Israeli soldiers.
abstract: Hamas fighters enter Israel from Gaza either by breaching the border fence or through tunnel, despite repeated Israeli efforts to block or destroy them; infiltrations come even as Israel presses deeper into Gaza, killing 48 Palestinians amid an intensifying ground war it says is focused on destroying labyrinth of tunnels before they can be used for launching attacks.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Gaza City, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Fares Akram and Tyler Hicks contributed reporting from Gaza City, and Carol Sutherland from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Even as Israeli forces moved to demolish militants’ tunnels into Israel, several Hamas fighters slipped through passages on Saturday and fought gun battles with Israeli soldiers.

headline.main: Despite Israeli Push in Gaza, Hamas Fighters Slip Through Tunnels
headline.print_headline: Despite Israeli Push in Gaza, Hamas Fighters Slip Through Tunnels
